a:s.a:s: /* * Library: IMMZD18SBCGLogic (IMMZ.D18.S.BCG schedule) * Schedule Table: IMMZ.D18.S.BCG schedule */ library IMMZD18SBCGLogic

def.name: One BCG dose from the primary series was administered. The primary series has been completed

a:t.name: complete
a:t.value: One BCG dose from the primary series was administered. The primary series has been completed

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: "Completed the primary vaccination series" = TRUE (where "Vaccine type" = "BCG vaccines")

a:s.a:s: "One BCG primary series dose was administered"

expression.name: One BCG primary series dose was administered

a:s.a:s: "One BCG dose from the primary series was administered. The primary series has been completed"

operand.name: One BCG dose from the primary series was administered. The primary series has been completed

a:t.name: create
a:t.value: BCG dose should be provided if the client has not received any BCG doses and is in a high incidence of tuberculosis (TB) and/or high leprosy burden. It should also be provided after a negative test result for tuberculin skin test (TST) or interferon-gamma release assay (IGRA) tests. The client should also receive vaccination if they are infected with HIV, on antiretroviral therapy (ART) and clinically well and immunologically stable. This dose also applies to neonates born to women with an unknown HIV status, as well as neonates with an unknown HIV status who were born to women infected with HIV.

a:s.a:s: 'BCG dose should be provided if the client has not received any BCG doses and is in a high incidence of tuberculosis (TB) and/or high leprosy burden. It should also be provided after a negative test result for tuberculin skin test (TST) or interferon-gamma release assay (IGRA) tests. The client should also receive vaccination if they are infected with HIV, on antiretroviral therapy (ART) and clinically well and immunologically stable. This dose also applies to neonates born to women with an unknown HIV status, as well as neonates with an unknown HIV status who were born to women infected with HIV.'

operand.value: BCG dose should be provided if the client has not received any BCG doses and is in a high incidence of tuberculosis (TB) and/or high leprosy burden. It should also be provided after a negative test result for tuberculin skin test (TST) or interferon-gamma release assay (IGRA) tests. The client should also receive vaccination if they are infected with HIV, on antiretroviral therapy (ART) and clinically well and immunologically stable. This dose also applies to neonates born to women with an unknown HIV status, as well as neonates with an unknown HIV status who were born to women infected with HIV.

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: To be determined by Member States; however, there is no recommended overdue date and individuals are always eligible to be vaccinated

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: To be determined by Member States; however, there is no recommended expiration date and individuals are always eligible to be vaccinated
